Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82 to lead India to a last-ball win over Pakistan.
India restricted Pakistan to 159-8 and won by four wickets.
Kohli and Hardik Pandya had a century stand, with Pandya scoring 40.
Mohammad Nawaz bowled the final over, which included wides and no-balls, helping India reach their target.
Arshdeep Singh dismissed Babar Azam for a golden duck and Mohammad Rizwan for four.
Iftikhar Ahmed hit three sixes in one over from Axar Patel and reached his half-century.
Hardik Pandya took three wickets in the space of 19 runs.
KL Rahul was out in the second over to Naseem Shah.
Haris Rauf dismissed Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav.
Kohli hit three sixes in one over off Nawaz.
Kohli smashed two sixes off Haris Rauf to leave 16 from the final over.
Ashwin hit the winning runs with a shot over mid-off.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised Virat Kohli's innings as the best he has played for India.
Virat Kohli expressed disbelief and credited Hardik Pandya for encouraging him to believe they could win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of 90,000 fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
India have largely dominated Pakistan since the late 1990s but lost two of their three previous clashes.
